summary: This document is an email from Jeffrey Epstein to Jes Staley discussing the stay of an individual named Peter at a location referred to as '71 st' over the weekend. Epstein suggests organizing a visit with Staley and possibly another individual named Jamie, indicating a desire for discretion.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the sender of the email, discussing arrangements for a visitor.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Staley is the recipient of the email, being asked to organize a visit.

persons.name: Peter
persons.context: Peter is mentioned as someone who will be staying at a location over the weekend.

persons.name: Jamie
persons.context: Jamie is mentioned as a possible companion for Staley during the visit.

connections.description: Epstein and Staley are communicating about personal arrangements, indicating a social connection.
Staley is suggested to potentially meet with Jamie during the visit, indicating a social connection.

keyFacts: The email was sent by Jeffrey Epstein to Jes Staley on August 18, 2009.
Epstein mentions that Peter will be staying at '71 st' over the weekend.
Epstein suggests organizing a visit with Staley and possibly another individual named Jamie.
The communication indicates a desire for discretion regarding the visit.
